text: This month, the Jan. 6 committee will hold public hearings to share their findings on what happened during last year's violent insurrection attempt. The first is this Thursday at 8 pm. Here's what to watch for: https://t.co/5Ft4BT0t07
246 mass shootings in the last 6 months, including one in our very own Hempstead just this past weekend. Enough is enough. Congress must act to stop gun violence. https://t.co/qNRgmL3hYY

Check out the all the fun #Pride events happening on Long Island this month, and don't miss out on @PrideForYouth's Pride After Dark at @HofstraU this Saturday! Festivities begin at 6 PM!  https://t.co/2lB9caHtM3

Congratulations to Natalie Hayes from East Rockaway High School for winning this year's Congressional Art Competition with her submission, "A Never Ending Abyss." You can check out all of our incredible submissions here: https://t.co/p2A8ycN1RA https://t.co/t5B7HNUDtG

Great news! I'm so grateful to live in a state that is willing to pass these commonsense gun safety regulations to protect its citizens. Now it's time to institute them nationwide so that all Americans feel safe. https://t.co/jxZEMTGeS1
This problem isn't going away. Every day we fail to pass meaningful gun safety legislation, more innocent lives are lost. https://t.co/KAGJvwvstx

Today marks the first day of hurricane season. With experts predicting a busy season, now is the time to start planning ahead. Here are some tips from the @RedCross on how to best prepare:
https://t.co/VHikDeoYPq

Happy #PrideMonth! I'm proud to be an ally of the LGBTQ+ community today and every day. This June, I am recommitting to fighting against hateful legislation that targets the trans community and LGBTQ youth. https://t.co/yzNHg8ms3p
